sub_title: Project Supporter bij PZH || Public Sector || Cum Laude Graduate Adv. MSc IR and Diplomacy
summary:
--> Enthusiastic, driven and self-motivated Cum Laude graduate of the Advanced MSc International Relations and Diplomacy from Leiden University and The Clingendael Institute. 
--> First-class degree (BA) in International Relations from the University of Exeter. 
--> Passionate about EU matters, Security studies, Militarized AI, Arms Control, Disarmament, Environmental issues
--> Good at managing time pressure and comfortable in public speaking, events organisation and group work.  
--> Fluent in Italian and English. Advanced in Spanish and Dutch.

projects:
[{'title': 'Grand Challenges - Confronting the complex security challenges of the future. Do nuclear weapons have a future?', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': '	Grand Challenges has been an extremely useful project that helped me to acquire some key lifetime skills such as problem solving, critical analysis and team working. We assumed the role of key decision-makers, analysing the issue of nuclear proliferation and making predictions of future possible scenarios as well as what the UK’s role should be in each specific context.

	 As part of the Grand Challenges, every student has realized a piece of applied writing in the form of a Ministerial Submission. This task was fulfilled after an intense research-based learning, presenting our personal understanding of the issue we have been tackling during the week. 

	As students of Strategic Security, we had the great opportunity to further our personal 
knowledge attending lectures led by key guests such Rob Wainwright (Director of Europol), Sir Jon Day (Chair of the Joint Intelligence Committee), and Sir Paul Newton (he retired as a Lieutenant General (3*) in 2012) followed by a Q&A. We gained a valuable insight into general security, re-evaluating my ideas in confronting the complex problems.  
', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Diletta M. L.', 'last_name': 'Alparone', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Project Supporter bij PZH || Public Sector || Cum Laude Graduate Adv. MSc IR and Diplomacy'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Sarah', 'last_name': 'Witty', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Sr. Product Strategist with Fusion, an enterprise accelerator at UnitedHealth Group'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Hannah', 'last_name': 'Priest', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Masters Graduate with Distinction MA Public Policy'}]}, {'title': "Sprint Programme: women's development for undergraduate", 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': 'Sprint is a programme designed for undergraduate women who want to further discover and develop their skills in a working environment. The project consisted in a 3-day workshop during which we worked on the importance of self-branding, networking, time-management, the concepts of power and assertiveness, defining our core values and strenghts as well as learning valuable techniques to deal with negative feelings that may inhibit our personal development.  

We also had the great opportunity to get inspired by strong and incredible women such as Barbara Harvey (Managing Director - Accenture), Vicky Wilkinson (RBS) and Caroline Birkby (Project Manger: Dynamics Global Domain - Microsoft).
The project will end with a half day workshop in April, where my group will deliver a Presentation about "Tomorrow's Women", followed by a mock interview', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Diletta M. L.', 'last_name': 'Alparone', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Project Supporter bij PZH || Public Sector || Cum Laude Graduate Adv. MSc IR and Diplomacy'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Laetitia', 'last_name': 'Devoud', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Strategy Consultant at Arthur D. Little | ESCP'}]}, {'title': "'The Future and Past of Brexit' ", 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'description': "I have worked in a student-organising committee to help organising a series of events named 'The Future and Past of Brexit', which took place on March 28th, 2019, the day before the expected Brexit day.  
The first event of the day was divided into two parts: the first part was a classic roundtable discussion, where the speakers talked about the How, Why, and 'What Next' of Brexit; the second part was a group-discussion where the speakers engaged with students and tried to tackle problems like the future UK-EU relationship, how Brexit will affect the UK, how the EU will change without Great Britain and how Brexit affects people.
During the session, I played the role of moderator, chairing the event, introducing the speakers and trying to make the discussion run smoothly. 

Our guests included: Professor Alison Harcourt, Dr Alex Prichard, Professor Helen Drake and Sir Ivan Rogers ", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Diletta M. L.', 'last_name': 'Alparone', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Project Supporter bij PZH || Public Sector || Cum Laude Graduate Adv. MSc IR and Diplomacy'}]}, {'title': 'Global Health and Human Rights - Geneva Summer School', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': 'I have attended a two week course about Global Health and Human Rights at the University of Geneva. The course focused on the interconnection between the two above-mentioned fields, looking at key elements such as the social determinants of health, the states' role and attitude towards Treaties and Conventions (UNDHR, the Convention of the rights of the child, Convention against Torture and Other Cruel, Inhuman or Degrading Treatment or Punishment etc.), the impact of globalization on the health of the population, health policies fostering non-discrimination of patients and vulnerable groups ( people with disabilities and elderly). 

As part of the course, we had the opportunity to visit the World Health Organization (WHO), the Palais des Nations,The Joint United Nations Programme on HIV/AIDS (UNAIDS), the Redcross, and the EU permanent mission in Geneva. 

Among the speakers, we had the pleasure to meet Quinten lataire (Human Rights Officer, UNAIDS), Facundo Chavez (Human Rights Disability Advisor, UNOHCHR), Alexander Breitegger (Legal Advisor, Thematic Legal Advise Unit, ICRC), Carmen Williams (Executive Editor, Health and Human Rights Journal), Jean-Sébastien Blanc (Detention Advisor, APT)

At the end of the course, my group and I have been assessed with a 10 page report and a 20 minute presentation about the Elderly ("How discrimination of the Elderly affects their health).', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Diletta M. L.', 'last_name': 'Alparone', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Project Supporter bij PZH || Public Sector || Cum Laude Graduate Adv. MSc IR and Diplomacy'}]}]
